_header: Deem the best in every doubt / Til the truth be tried out
Note:
See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 344; for a copy formerly listed under this entry, see 1111.

BodRawC86.Transcription:
Deame þe best in euery dowteTyl þe trouthe be tryed
                    oute

CULIi326.Transcription:
Deme the beste of euery dowteTyll the trowth be tryed oouteA
                    harde thynge hit is y wysTo deme a thynge that vnknowen isAqueyntanse
                    of lordschip wyll y noghtffor furste or laste dere hit woll be
                    bowght
CULIi326.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.205.

BLAdd31922.Transcription: Deme þe best of euery dowttyll the trowth be tryed owt

BLHar1587.Transcription: Deme the best of euery dowteTill the trewth be tried owte
BLHar1587.Note:
Translating ‘In dubiis
                    servi…’. Repeated twelve-plus times down the page, parallel with repeated copies of the Latin version on f. 211v.
